ch.linetic.analysis

Interface AnalyzerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Analyzer, ClapAnalyzer, HandShakinessAnalyzer, HandsProximityAnalyzer, MultiplicityAnalyzer, OrientationAnalyzer, ShakinessAnalyzer, SpeedAnalyzer

    public interface AnalyzerInterface
    The analyzer is the building block of the project. Each analyzers analyzes the movement of the user in its own way. The behavior of the analyzer is located in the analyze() function.
    Author:
    ketsio

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float RANGE_MAX 
      static float RANGE_MIN 

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Equivalent to : analyze(movement, true);
      float analyze(MovementInterface movement, boolean rescaled)
      Analyze the movement in its own way
      boolean doTrigger(float finalValue)
      Check if we can trigger the result to all the clients connected given the result between RANGE_MIN and RANGE_MAX

    • Method Detail

      • analyze

        float analyze(MovementInterface movement)
        Equivalent to : analyze(movement, true);

      • analyze

        float analyze(MovementInterface movement,
            boolean rescaled)
        Analyze the movement in its own way
        Parameters:
        movement - : the movement to be analyzed
        rescaled - : if the value is rescaled to be between RANGE_MIN and RANGE_MAX
        Returns:
        the result of the analysis (raw or rescaled)

      • name

        java.lang.String name()
        Getter
        Returns:
        the name of the analyzer

      • getSlug

        java.lang.String getSlug()
        Getter
        Returns:
        the unique slug of the analyzer (no two analyzers should have the same slug)

      • doTrigger

        boolean doTrigger(float finalValue)
        Check if we can trigger the result to all the clients connected given the result between RANGE_MIN and RANGE_MAX
        Parameters:
        finalValue - the final result of the analyzer
        Returns:
        true if we should trigger, false otherwise
